All Classes

Class Description
BaseContainer
Super Class for DataContainer including common properties and their getter and setter methods.
BaseContainer.EContainerFormat
Enumeration that defines all source types, supported by the org.opentdk.api.datastorage package with its header format.
BaseContainer.EHeader
Enumeration that defines all header formats supported by the org.opentdk.api.datastorage package.
BaseDispatchComponent
Similar to the native enum type of java, the BaseDispatchComponent class is used to build a set of variables with the difference that their values are not static and extended access to the variables values and their attributes will be provided.
Each BaseDispatchComponent instance will be declared within a dispatcher definition class like EBaseSettings and the instance is associated with a node or field, depending on the format of the underlying DataContainer (tree or table format).

Main features of BaseDispatchComponent:
- Values and attributes of defined nodes or fields can be read from and written to the structure of the underlying DataContainer.
- In case the defined file file does not exist, it will be created once a setter method is called.
- In case that no file is associated with the dispatcher component, their values will be stored in runtime objects (DOM Document, Hashmap, Arraylist etc.) depending on the container format.
- Default values can be assigned to nodes or fields.
BaseDispatcher
BaseDispatcher is build as a super class which can be inherited by subclasses to implement a list of variables, associated with any supported DataContainer classes.
CheckFormat Deprecated.
CommonUtil
Class with common methods that get directly used in a static way.
Counter
This class allows to store increasing or decreasing integer values.
CryptoUtil
Class to decode and encode passwords.

Usage:
CSVDataContainer
SubClass of DataContainer which provides all methods for reading and writing from or to Ascii files that are column separated, and store the data at runtime within the DataContainer.
DataContainer
Class used to store data from different sources at runtime of an application in an ArrayList.
DataProvider
Class to create random floating point test data.

Usage:
DateUtil
Class with static utility methods to work with date, time and time stamp formats using the java.time package.
EBaseSettings
Settings class with predefined set of common application settings of type BaseDispatchComponent.
EFormat
Enumeration of all formats (date, time, time stamp) that the DateUtil class uses.
EMeter
The EMeter class represents elements similar to ENUMs that are used to perform measurements at runtime of an application.
E.g. the EMeter.TRANSACTION element calculates and returns the time between calling its Transaction.start(java.lang.String) method and Transaction.end(java.lang.String) method and returns the elapsed time.
EOperator  
FileUtil
Class with static methods to perform several I/O operations like reading files, creating files or checking files.
Filter
This class is used to define one or more conditions for selecting data from a datastorage.
FilterRule
This class is used to define rules that will be used for filtering DataSets from tabular data formats like DataContainer or in where and set conditions of SQL queries.

The following example defines the where condition of the SQL statement select * from customer where company = 'LK Test Solutions GmbH' and lastname = 'Meisinger' that can be used for the SQLStatement class to generate the statement:
JSONDataContainer  
ListUtil
Helper utility class for lists that contains only static methods to call them directly like:

ListUtil.asString(new ArrayList(...), ";");
MathUtil
Class with useful mathematical functions.
MLogger
Custom logging class which uses the Java Logging API for writing messages to a log file.
PropertiesDataContainer  
RSDataContainer  
SortedProperties  
StringUtil
Helper class with string methods for direct use in a static way.
Transaction
This class calculates and stores the time between calling its Transaction.start(java.lang.String) method and Transaction.end(java.lang.String) method and returns the elapsed time.
XFileWriter
This class uses FileWriter for write operations on ASCII files with additional functionality.
XMLDataContainer
SubClass of DataContainer which provides all methods for reading and writing from or to Ascii files in XML format, and store the data at runtime within the DataContainer.
XMLDataContainer.EImplicitHeaders  
XMLEditor
This class is used for read and write access to data which is stored in XML format.
YAMLDataContainer
